required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Adult Patients Receiving DUPIXENT® for Atopic Dermatitis (AD)
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Observational Study of Adult Patients Receiving DUPIXENT® for Atopic Dermatitis

brief_summary.textblock: A long-term observational registry in patients with atopic dermatitis initiating treatment with DUPIXENT® (dupilumab)

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective observational study conducted to (1) characterize the patients who receive DUPIXENT® for AD in a real world setting with respect to their medical history, socio-demographic and disease characteristics, and prior and concomitant treatments of AD; (2) characterize real world use patterns of DUPIXENT® for AD (eg, most commonly used regimens by line of therapy, reason for initiation of new treatments, concomitant therapies, treatment durations and reasons for discontinuation and/or switching); (3) assess the long-term effectiveness of DUPIXENT® in adult AD patients in a real world setting; (4) assess comorbid atopic conditions, patterns of use and effects of treatment in comorbid atopic conditions in adult patients who receive DUPIXENT® for AD; and (6) collect safety data on study participants

primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (day when DUPIXENT treatment is initiated)
At baseline (day when DUPIXENT treatment is initiated)

secondary_outcome.measure: Registry (Physician) Assessment: Body Surface Area Affected (BSA) by Atopic Dermatitis
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of BSA affected by AD assessed for each major section of the body

secondary_outcome.measure: Registry (Physician) Assessment: Eczema Area and Severity Index (EASI)
secondary_outcome.description: Measure used in clinical practice and clinical trials to assess the severity and extent of AD

secondary_outcome.measure: Registry (Physician) Assessment: Overall Disease Severity scale
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire used to characterizing the severity of AD on a 4-point scale (0=No disease, 1=Minimal disease, 2=Mild disease, 3=Moderate disease, 4=Severe disease)

secondary_outcome.measure: Registry (Participant) Assessment: Patient Oriented Eczema Measure
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire used in clinical practice and clinical trials to assess disease symptoms in children and adults

secondary_outcome.measure: Registry (Participant) Assessment: Pruritus Numerical Rating Scales (NRS)
secondary_outcome.description: Individual NRS used to rate the intensity of pruritus using a 0 to 10 numeric rating scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Registry (Participant) Assessment: Skin Pain or Soreness NRS
secondary_outcome.description: Individual NRS used to rate skin pain and soreness using a 0 to 10 NRS

secondary_outcome.measure: Registry (Participant) Assessment: Skin Feeling Hot NRS
secondary_outcome.description: Individual NRS used to rate the sensation of skin feeling hot (burning sensation) using a 0 to 10 NRS
Individual NRS used to rate skin sensitivity using a 0 to 10 NRS
Individual NRS used to report the severity of their sleep disturbance using a 0 to 10 NRS

secondary_outcome.measure: Registry (Participant) Assessment: Global Assessment of Atopic Dermatitis scale
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of overall well-being on a 5-point scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Registry (Participant) Assessment: Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI)
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire used in clinical practice and clinical trials to assess the impact of AD disease symptoms and treatment on quality of life (QOL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Registry (Participant) Assessment: Work Productivity and Activity Impairment Questionnaire for AD (WPAI-AD)
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire to assess the impact of AD on productivity

secondary_outcome.measure: Registry (Participant) Assessment: Health Care Resource Utilization Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire regarding hospitalization, or emergency room/ urgent care center visits due to AD

intervention.description: In addition to (or substituting for) DUPIXENT®, participants may receive marketed drugs as deemed necessary by their physicians for the treatment of AD or comorbid conditions.

biospec_descr.textblock: Optional sub-study: Blood samples will be collected at the scheduled visits and stored up to 10 years for future use in bio-marker research. Participants who agree to provide blood samples for future research will be required to sign a separate informed consent form (ICF) before collection of the samples.

study_pop.textblock: The target population is adult patients (male or female, ≥18 years old), who are initiating treatment with DUPIXENT® for AD according to the country-specific prescribing information.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Initiating treatment with DUPIXENT® for AD according to the country-specific prescribing information (Note: Participants will be screened when they received their initial prescription for DUPIXENT®)
2. Willing and able to comply with the study-related activities
3. Able to understand and complete study-related questionnaires
4. Provide signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients who have a contraindication to the drug according to the country-specific prescribing information label.
2. Any condition that, in the opinion of the investigator, may interfere with patient's ability to participate in the study, such as short life expectancy, substance abuse, severe cognitive impairment, or other co-morbidities that can predictably prevent the patient from adequately completing the schedule of visits and assessments.
